newsitem.title: USA: GTE sees 95.78 pct BBN shares tendered.
newsitem.headline: GTE sees 95.78 pct BBN shares tendered.

text.p: GTE Corp said that as of midnight EDT (0400 GMT) on June 9, about 95.78 percent of all outstanding shares of BBN Corp were validly tendered and not withdrawn.
The company said that its cash tender offer for BBN shares has now expired. The 95.78 percent represents about 21,395,837 shares.
GTE said it would buy the Internet service provider for $616 million or $29 a share in early May.

In the second step of the acquisition, BBN will be merged with GTE Massachusetts and become a wholly owned unit of GTE. Each BBN shares not previously purchased in the tender offer will be converted into the right to receive $29 in cash, without interest.

GTE said the merger will be completed as soon as practicable following a meeting of BBN stockholders. It added that because GTE owns shares representing more than two-thirds of the voting power of the outstanding BBN stock, the consummation of the merger is assured.
